intro: Tristemma mauritianum var. thomense, commonly known as the Mauritius thomense tristemma, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is considered a rare species and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role in the Mauritian ecosystem.
